books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about the moral nature of human beings.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a future totalitarian state.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel about the American dream.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: An epic sea story of Captain Ahab's voyage in pursuit of Moby Dick.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A historical novel about the French invasion of Russia.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about adolescent alienation and loss of innocence.

books.title: Ulysses
books.author: James Joyce
books.description: A complex modernist novel set in Dublin, Ireland.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: An epic poem about the journey of Odysseus, king of Ithaca, after the Trojan War.

books.title: In Search of Lost Time
books.author: Marcel Proust
books.description: A novel in seven volumes about involuntary memory.

books.title: A Tale of Two Cities
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: Set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

books.title: Les Misérables
books.author: Victor Hugo
books.description: A historical novel that covers a period of 17 years in the early 19th century France.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: The final novel by the Russian author, it explores ethics, free will, and morality.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A novel focusing on the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a destitute young man.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.description: A novel that follows the adventures of a man who reads so many chivalric romances.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A novel that depicts the passionate love between the wild, destructive Catherine and the rugged, brooding Heathcliff.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A novel that follows the lives of the Karamazov brothers, each with their own distinct personalities and desires.
